intro: Sprengelia incarnata var. montana, commonly known as the mountain spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open woodland habitats and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, soft pubescence, while its flowers bloom in early spring. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and hardy nature.
